references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces a foundational large-scale text-to-image diffusion model that is leveraged by the current paper for its strong generative capabilities.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper details the Stable Diffusion model, which is heavily used in the current paper as a pretrained model for its image generation capabilities.
This paper introduces the core denoising diffusion probabilistic models, the theoretical foundation upon which many modern generative models, including those used in this paper, are built.

references.paper_title: Towards robust monocular depth estimation: Mixing datasets for zero-shot cross-dataset transfer
references.reason: This paper provides a robust monocular depth estimation model, which is crucial for the geometric warping component of many novel view synthesis methods, including the one proposed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: The unreasonable effectiveness of deep features as a perceptual metric
references.reason: This paper introduces the LPIPS metric which is used to evaluate the perceptual quality of generated images, providing a robust evaluation technique used extensively in this paper.
